body_html: I don't know of any plans to implement a heterogeneous total_count. However since you're using the categorical sampler torch.multinomial(), you should be able to create an extra zero-probability bin and mask out the categorical samples above total_count to fall in this bin, then discard them.

body: I don't know of any plans to implement a heterogeneous total_count. However since you're using the categorical sampler `torch.multinomial()`, you should be able to create an extra zero-probability bin and mask out the categorical samples above `total_count` to fall in this bin, then discard them.
